subject: Looking for advice on testing scenario
msgSnippet: Hi, I am new to JUNIT and although I ve read all of the docs (save the javadoc) it s not entirely clear to me how to proceed or even if JUNIT is appropriate
messageBody:
Hi,

I am new to JUNIT and although I've read all of the docs (save the
javadoc) it's not entirely clear to me how to proceed or even if JUNIT
is appropriate for my needs. I will explain the situation and was
hoping that maybe someone could point me in the right direction.

I have written a SQL parser which parses a SQL query and builds an
object model representation of same which it returns as the result of
a parse. The object model has the ability to print itself and so long
as the parser works correctly what it prints will be very close to the
input query. A single test case then consists of parsing a query,
calling printMe( ) on the resultant tree and comparing it's output to
what was expected, which again, is very similar to but not identical
to the original query.

So, first a general question: I know that his is closer to end to end
testing than it is to the sort of fine grained class level tests JUNIT
is designed for. Is JUNIT even appropriate? Assuming the answer is
yes, I'll continue.

The pseudo code for a single test case would look like this:

String orgnlQry = "Select * from MyTable.MyColumn";
String expectedQry = "Select * from MyColumn";
Parser myParser = new Parser( );
// A bunch of code to construct Parser and connect to data store
myParser.parse(orgnlQry);
SQLTree tree = myParser.getTree( );
String outQry = tree.printMe( );
assertEquals(outQry, expectedQry);

I'd like all of my test cases to use the same parser instance so that
I only have to initialize it once. The only variables for each test
than are the orgnl/expectedQry pairs of which I've got about 120.

I'm able to get a single test case running but I can't figure out how
to eliminate duplicate code. I'm also no sure how to organize the
tests. Shold there really be 120 different test methods or is there
some way to call the same test method 120 times with different input
strings?

Thanks in advance for any suggestions anyone can provide.

-ts1971
